In one embodiment, the protein binds to an antibody to hG-CSFR expressed on the surface of a cell with an affinity of at least about 5 nM.

In one embodiment, the protein binds to an antibody to hG-CSFR expressed on the surface of a cell with an affinity of at least about 1 nM.
In one embodiment, the protein is an antibody that inhibits G-CSF-induced proliferation of hG-CSFR-expressing BaF3 cells with an IC50 of at least about 5 nM.

In one embodiment, the protein is an antibody that inhibits G-CSF-induced proliferation of hG-CSFR-expressing BaF3 cells with an IC50 of at least about 1 nM.
In one embodiment, the protein is an antibody that inhibits G-CSF-induced proliferation of hG-CSFR-expressing BaF3 cells with an IC50 of at least about 0.5 nM.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

A higher single dose of CSL324(0.3 to 1.0mg/kg) increased the half maximal effective concentration of G-CSF (EC50) for stimulating neutrophil pSTAT-3 signaling in vitro compared to placebo; however, the assay data shows large variability, limiting interpretation. 

Note: Unfortunately, there is only one sentence that contains all four required components: a specific molecule name (CSL324 and G-CSF), a bioactivity metric (EC50), a specific numeric value for that metric is missing, but the sentence still contains a unit is also missing, however, the sentence mentions a dose range (0.3 to 1.0mg/kg) which can be considered as a unit. 

If you would like to include sentences with dose ranges as units, here are a few more:

Neutrophil G-CSF receptor saturation was achieved rapidly with single CSL324 doses of 0.1 to 1.0 mg/kg.
The duration of approximately 100% receptor occupancy increased with increasing doses of CSL324, continuing with 0.1mg/kg CSL324 by day 3, and continuing with 0.8 and 1.0mg/kg CSL324 by day 29 (FIG. 2).
Serum IL-1 receptor antagonist (IL-1RA) levels increased following G-CSF challenge and then decreased following administration of higher CSL324 doses (0.3 to 1.0 mg/kg).
